feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:19AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Wednesday Through Friday... A cold front will bring Snow and blowing snow to the Eastern Brooks range Today then another front will push through Thursday night into Friday. There could be 2 to 4 inches of snow in the lower elevations, with up to 6 inches near Atigun Pass. Blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. This could make travel

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 31 at 3:17AM AKDT until May 31 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Rain transitioning to snow early this morning. Total snow accumulations around 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. Heaviest amounts from Glennallen to the north and northeast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rapid River Rises for Eastern Interior Rivers Into Friday ... Moderate to heavy rain showers will continue across parts of the Interior through Wednesday evening. Periods of rain will result in an area of 0.5 to 1.25 inches of additional accumulations in the Fortymile Uplands and Salcha/Goodpaster/Chena River Basins through Wednesday evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 9:21AM PDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .High mountain snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:26AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WILDFIRE POTENTIAL FOR UPPER MICHIGAN TODAY DUE TO A COMBINATION OF GUSTY WINDS, DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS... Gusty southerly winds as high as 20 mph, combined with dry and warm conditions and a lack of recent rainfall will lead to elevated wildfire potential today across Upper Michigan. Avoid outdoor burning today. Immediately report any wildfires

entry.title: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 12:32PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Montana, including the following counties, Big Horn, Carbon, Golden Valley, Musselshell, Park, Rosebud, Stillwater, Sweet Grass, Treasure, Wheatland and Yellowstone.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 11:03AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Mountain snowmelt continues before cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. Overall, water levels on Pacific Creek will show little change through the weekend.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:59AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues before cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. Overall, river levels will show little change

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:55AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming continues the Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues before cooler weather arrives to end the week. This will slow mountain snowmelt above 8,000 feet, decreasing flows on tributaries feeding the Bear River.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:10AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding along the Bear River from below Woodruff Narrows Reservoir northward to the Utah/Wyoming line west of Sage Junction, Wyoming caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases. * WHERE...Portions of northern Utah and southwest Wyoming, including
